pages.title: Brown Bear
pages.text: The brown bear (Ursus arctos) is a large bear species found across Eurasia and North America. One of the smaller-bodied forms, the Himalayan brown bear, is critically endangered, occupying only 2% of its former range and threatened by uncontrolled poaching for its body parts. As of 2012, this and the American black bear are the only bear species not classified as threatened by the IUCN. In North America, the populations of brown bears are called grizzly bears. Many of the populations in the southern parts of Eurasia are highly endangered as well.
